channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for KS

item.title: Report E-2024070396
item.description:
Report E-2024070396

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-19T18:15:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-12
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 12, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN1824 was punctured in transit by other freight and released approximately thirty (30) gallons of product to the trailer interior and pavement beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Works, Inc. (EWI) to remediate the impacted site. EWI personnel placed the damaged 55-gallon drum into one (1) 95-gallon poly overpack. Crews deployed neutralizing, granular absorbents to the impacted trailer floor and asphalt and swept them up with hand tools. Two (2) 55-gallon drums of neutralized product and any cleanup debris, and the one (1) 95-gallon overpack of the damaged drum were staged onsite for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024070424
item.description:
Report E-2024070424

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-19T18:15:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-27
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that 1-quart of Gray Primer released from one (1) 5-gallon metal pail impacting the trailer floor. ERTS reviewed the SDS with terminal personnel who felt comfortable cleaning the release with oil dri and the proper PPE available onsite. Terminal personnel placed the waste into a 20-gallon poly drum in the facilities waste area for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024070888
item.description:
Report X-2024070888

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-15T18:15:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-05
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: LEAKER WAS CALLED INTO THE DMP AND DMP DISPATCHED A RESPONDER WITH FULL PPE AND SPILL CART. RESPONDER ARRIVED ON SCENE AND FOUND THE LEAKER. RESPONDER CONSULTED WITH THE DECSION TREE ON HOW TO PROCEED WITH THE SPILL. RESPONDER FOLLOWED THE GUIDLINES AND CLEANED UP THE SPILL USING APPRIATE PPE. RESPONDER BROUGHT LEAKER BACK TO THE DMP FOR PROPER DISPOSAL. LEAKER WAS PROPERLY DISPOSED OF.

item.title: Report E-2024070236
item.description:
Report E-2024070236

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-13
  • City: KANSAS CITY

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that 2-quarts of 10-minute drain opener gel spilled from a 2-quart plastic jug. The spill occurred inside the trailer. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and they felt confident cleaning the spill with the available PPE onsite.
